channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3028] Saw this car parked outside my apartment today [PIC]
[+1591] NASA found 99% Pure Water Ice on Mars
item.description: NASA’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (MRO) has revealed sub-surface water ice that may be 99 percent pure, halfway between the North Pole and the equator on the Red Planet.

item.title: [+1551] Hooters Girl Barstool Beer Trick
[+1350] "Big Fat Black Lady" Angered by Gas Station Receipt
item.description: Helen Hodges understood the need for a gas station clerk to write her identifying information on a sales receipt. She just wishes he had chosen a different phrase.

item.title: [+1102] Movie Poster Mash-Ups - The Next Generation
item.description: B3ta had a contest with the rules being: Take any film you wish, and photoshop the scenery, characters or titles into the style of a famous movie poster for a different film... The results are awesome.

item.title: [+947] This is the one who broke into my house last night [PIC]
[+911] Javascript in a single picture [PIC]
[+875] Not quite sure what this had to do with the G20...
[+799] Texas Police to Persecute and Prosecute Blog Commenters
item.description: Austin, Texas cops say they have had enough of commenters on blogs. They are threatening legal action. Options under discussion appear to be not only libel suits, but also criminal charges if the police believe these are warranted. Among the suggestions allegedly implied under this cloak was behavior of an illegal and sexual nature...

item.title: [+711] New Super Mario Bros. Wii: Official Box Art Revealed
item.description: Nintendo released the official Box Art for New Super Mario Bros. Wii, the game will be available on 11/15/09

item.title: [+683] Star Trek TNG Light-Switch Plates Are Extremely Nerdy
item.description: Nerd much? On the ThinkGeek website, the description of these light and power-outlet wall switches mentions LCARS. If you know without googling exactly what LCARS is, you also probably already have these installed in your bedroom. You are probably already making sweet, sweet love to an alien from the Delta quadrant. Or, perhaps, an android.

item.title: [+667] Polanski Arrested on 1970s Rape Charge
item.description: Filmmaker Roman Polanski was arrested on rape charges dating from the 1970s, the Zurich Film Festival announced Sunday.

item.title: [+659] 14 Awesome and Badass Super Mario Wallpapers
item.description: The most badass Super Mario wallpapers to spice up your desktop.

item.title: [+619] Happy 11th Birthday, Google. Nice Logo!
item.description: It’s Google’s 11th birthday on Sunday, September 27th: to celebrate, the company has changed its logo to a version that turns the letter “L” into the number 11. The logo is already viewable in Europe.

item.title: [+599] Jenny Slate drops F-bomb on SNL premiere (Video)
[+559] The Hubble Ultra Deep Field in 3D - Boing Boing
item.description: This amazing animation was rendered using the measured redshift of all 10,000 galaxies in the Hubble Ultra Deep Field image.

item.title: [+556] Stunning Pieces Of Digital Art That Would Make You Say 'Wow'
item.description: These are the wonder creations of designers who use their creativity with a different angle and approach to get the result that makes a difference.

item.title: [+536] 25 Dogs Dressed Like Star Wars Characters [Photos]
item.description: Odd photos of dogs being crammed into humiliating, geeky costumes to make us humans laugh.

item.title: [+508] Reno Casino Hits Geothermal Jackpot Underground
item.description: A geothermal water source just north of the new 17-story hotel tower will generate enough heat and hot water for all 2.1 million sq ft of the resort's space. The system will be used to heat all restaurants, casino floors, plus every shower and sink in 1,600 hotel rooms year-round. The project is expected to save $1 million a year in energy costs.

item.title: [+466] Obama Keeps Bush Rules On Indefinite Detention
item.description: The Obama administration has decided not to ask Congress for a new law that would allow terrorism detainees to be held indefinitely - in other words, it'll stay with the rules set up right after the Sept. 11 attacks by the Bush administration. What does this decision say about Obama as president?
